DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether co-morbid conditions exist.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Concepts.definition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subject has other co-morbid c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subject has other co-morbid condition(s) that, in the opinion of the Investigator could limit the subject's ability to participate in the study or impact the scientific integrity of the study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have other co-morbid condition(s) that would limit the subject's ability to have major abdominal surgery as part of the study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any current comorbidities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have other comorbid conditions that would prevent the participant from having colonoscopies or would prevent required follow-up?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have comorbid conditions as specified in section 3 of the protocol?
